alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 7:08PM CST until March 09 at 2:50PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 372.0 feet, Evacuation road from Big River Plantation Resort is flooded. Most evacuation roads in bottom lands near Savannah are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 371.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 367.8 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
